message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you the opportunity to purchase this product. Given its value and potential, I'm initially suggesting a price of $950,000. I believe this is a fair starting point for a mutually beneficial deal.
I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $900,000. I believe this is a more reasonable price given the product's value and my budget.

Bob, I understand your perspective on the price.  After considering your offer, I'm willing to come down slightly to $925,000. This reflects the product's true worth and ensures a win-win for both of us.
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but I'm still a bit higher than $925,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $875,000. This is my final offer, so I hope we can come to an agreement.

Bob, I appreciate you working with me on this. I understand your position, but $875,000 is cutting it too close to my bottom line. How about we meet in the middle at $900,000? This demonstrates my commitment to getting this deal done.
I appreciate your persistence, but I'm still a bit too high on the price. I'm willing to pay $850,000 for the product. This is my best and final offer, so I hope we can come to an agreement.
